profile.relationships: Married for 20 years with 2 daughters (18 and 19)
profile.biography: Howdy. I'm a Texan guy living in the United Kingdom now for over 18 years. I currently work as an Infrastructure and deployment manager for a company called Cognito and I volunteer as a trustee and webmaster of The Druid Network - a registered charity in English and Wales. All the while juggling coursework for an Open University degree.

educations.title: Open University
educations.location: Distance Learning assessed by coursework and supervised exams
educations.description:
Modules:
  • Environment: journeys through a changing world (U116)
  • Introducing the social sciences - part one (DD131)
  • Introducing the social sciences - part two (DD132)
  • Exploring Science (S104)
  • Energy and sustainability (T213)
  • Environmental management 1 (T219) - In Progress
People often ask why I'm trying for this degree and that question always catches me off guard because I really don't have a good answer. I do have a deep and abiding interest in the topic. And yes, it may help me go for jobs in the future whether they're environmentally related or not. Perhaps I might even take a totally different career path someday. The guilty truth of the matter is that I'm mostly doing it for is the pure fun of learning new things, keeping my mind ticking, and the sheer adventure.

educations.title: Texas State Technical College
educations.description: A year of courses including Cobol and Pascal programming, operating systems, etc.

careers.title: Cognito
careers.description: Managing the Service Operations team, I'm responsible for: deploying and maintaining networks, server infrastructure, platforms, and software applications for new and existing projects; collaborating closely with both the DevOps and Change Management teams to streamline deployments and safeguard operational integrity; providing third-line support for the entire infrastructure, platform and software estate; and providing expertise in monitoring and tuning of: Operating systems, JBoss, Tomcat, VMWare ESXi, Informix, etc.

careers.title: The Druid Network
careers.description: The Druid Network is a registered charity in England and Wales (1138265) and I'm one of the volunteer trustees that run the day to day operations. I'm also the webmaster and look after both the former Drupal powered site and the new Wordpress powered public site and ELGG powered private user forum.

careers.title: Nuance Communications
careers.description: Here my primary role was as an Incident manager - a senior Linux engineer monitoring and supporting the entire operational services of SpinVox and Nuance for over 30 enterprise customers and thousands of individual customers.

careers.title: SpinVox
careers.location: Maidenhead and Marlow, Berkshire, United Kingdom
careers.description: In June 2008 I was given the opportunity for promotion to Infrastructure and Deployment Manager. In this role I managed 6 system administrators, 2 storage managers, and 3 Informix DBAs, the release team leader, and also the testing team leader. Along with the 120 servers I was responsible for in the previous role I also had Cisco networking equipment and IBM storage devices to support.

careers.title: SpinVox
careers.location: Maidenhead and Marlow, Berkshire, United Kingdom
careers.description: My primary role was managing a team of two system administrators and ten software testers. I was responsible for the successful deployment of systems software to the live environment - 120 individual servers in a fully redundant and load balanced environment across three sites supporting up to 3,000,000 voice messages a day.

careers.title: Carefone Services
careers.description: As head administrator, I managed a 4 man team responsible for the technical implementation and support of internal hardware and software products in the UK, France, Germany, South Africa and Australia. I established policies for server deployments, maintenance, and security. I performed day-to-day maintenance of server, workstation, and network equipment for internal and product related infrastructure – comprising roughly 50 servers plus networking equipment. I ensured compliance with SLA’s and performance standards through product benchmarking and proactive monitoring.

careers.title: Funderburg Ltd
careers.description: I was a contract Informix 4GL Programmer. During this time I worked with Davy Stockbrokers, United Gas, and Informix Ltd (who subcontracted me to Londis and Bull Information Systems.

careers.title: Chase Manhattan Bank
careers.description: I assisted in the development and support of the Global Investment Manager (GIM II) for Chase Manhattan Bank.

careers.title: The United States Air Force
careers.location: RAF Upper Heyford, Oxfordshire, United Kingdom
careers.description: My duties included: Loading and unloading of nuclear and nonnuclear munitions, explosives, and propellant devices on aircraft, and managing, controlling, maintaining, and installing aircraft bomb, rocket, and missile release, launch, suspension, and monitor systems; guns and gun mounts; and related munitions handing, loading, and test equipment.

interests.title: Adventure
interests.description: XKCD says it best: "The infinite possibilities each day holds should stagger the mind. The sheer number of experiences I could have is uncountable, breathtaking, and I'm sitting here refreshing my inbox. We lived trapped in loops, reliving a few days over and over, and we envision only a handful of paths laid out ahead of us. We see the same things each day, we respond the same way, we think the same thoughts, each day a slight variation on the last, every moment smoothly following the gentle curves of societal norms. We act like if we just get through today, tomorrow our dreams will come back to us. And no, I don't have all the answers. I don't know how to jolt myself into seeing what each moment could become. But I do know one thing: the solution doesn't involve watering down my every little idea and creative impulse for the sake of some day easing my fit into a mold. It doesn't involve tempering my life to better fit someone's expectations. It doesn't involve constantly holding back for fear of shaking things up. This is very important, so I want to say it as clearly as I can: FUCK. THAT. SHIT."

interests.title: Technology and Geekery
interests.description: I first laid my hands on a computer - A Commodore 64 - in 1985. In a few days I'd written my first programme in Basic and I instantly knew this was what I was going to do with my life. A decade later, after moving to England and getting my permanent residency, I was trained as an Informix 4GL programmer. While I was good at this, my passion was for doing the more complex systems administration tasks and when Linux starting becoming more popular I was hooked. I've worked as some form of systems administrator ever since and eventually ended up managing other sys admins. It's paid the bills. Aside from that I'm a fan of RPG gaming. I think I've played every Zelda and Final Fantasy ever made including some bizarre Japanese ones. I also like simulated worlds. Second Life was a huge part of my life for years and I still have some very special friends from that time. Minecraft then took over - before it became the abode of 10 year olds. I even ran my own server for a time but now it's mostly closed down

interests.title: Gardening
interests.description: I took up an allotment garden in 2011 because I had a craving for better tomatoes! At various particular points in the year you'll find me organically growing onions, garlic, leeks, potatoes, peppers, cherries, pears, broad beans, runner beans, courgettes, carrots, rhubarb, peas, raspberries, blackberries, various herbs and spices, one or two pumpkins, and vast amounts of multi-coloured tomatoes that I either eat like candy, fill burgers with, or turn into salsa. I'm also a keen forager of blackberries and plums from roadside trees when they're in season.  During the winter I go sit in my shed in Saturday mornings whist drinking coffee and reading books.  When it's too cold to do that, I've actually learned how to knit!

interests.title: Fitness and Diet
interests.description: Ladies and gentlemen, I am now and have been for some time: a fat man. There's no getting away from that. I became lazy and complacent in my mid 20's. During my entire 30's I did no exercise and let my fitness just waste away. However, in the Summer of 2014, at the age of 41, with painful joints and possibly on the verge of getting diabetes, on the top of a mountain in the Scottish Highlands, I made a decision to lose just a bit more than 4 stone (56 lbs) in one year. To that end, I count calories (no fad diets!), avoid processed food in favour of fresh and home-made, walk or cycle or run every single day, and do a bit of yoga at a new studio in town. I won't lie - it's all bloody hard work. Failure however isn't even a possibility and a current goal is to achieve 3/4 of my target weight loss by the spring of 2015 and then cycle the length of Wales from Chepstow to Holyhead. To date I've lost around 20 lbs and where I originally couldn't run more than 20 seconds, I'm currently interval training at 3km in preparation to run my first 5k by Christmas!

interests.title: Environmental Studies, Politics, and Activism
interests.description: Ideologically I'm a social libertarian almost bordering on anarchist. Politically, in the UK, although I can't vote, I strongly support the Green Party and share their values and ethics. I regularly give to organisations that work to protect and conserve the environment, promote peace, encourage equality, or support social and environmental justice such as: Greenpeace, The Woodland Trust, World Wildlife Fund, and Friends of The Earth. Locally I support Newbury Cat's Protection by sponsoring a pen in memory of our cat Piper. Whist most of my "activism" is confined to my bank account and armchair, issues like fracking and badger culls are likely to get me out on the streets.

interests.title: Pagan Druidry
interests.description: Ah religion. A dirty work nowadays and not something people talk about in depth. This is the specific one I practice. Don't worry I won't be trying to convert anyone. Nor will anyone catch me dancing naked around Stonehenge.  Have you BEEN there?  It's always too cold for that nonsense!  ;-) To me, Druidry is simply a pathway to living with honour and intent, fiercely respecting and defending all of nature, the spirits of place, the gods, and my ancestors. It's also an outlet to sacrifice my time and energy in the service to my community.
